creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Christ standing to R of gnarled tree, facing a grotesque figure with beastly head, wings, webbed fingers, fish tail, and human legs; at ULC, small image of Christ on a plateau; at UR, small image of Christ standing atop a building, in both miniatures facing a similar looking beast
inscription:
Signature, Inscription

-- numbered in plate at upper right: [11.]
-- on verso, old 20th-century price code.
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Temptation of Christ, From the Life of Christ, Plate 11
